title: Man born on board a Turkish Airlines plane grows up to be a flight attendant... with Turkish Airlines (well, he was bound to feel at home)

It's not surprising to hear that Erkan Geldi, a Turkish Airlines flight attendant, feels at home on an aircraft.
Not only does he spend the majority of his time today jetting around the globe on the carrier's fleet - but his entire life started out that way.
Erkan was born on a Turkish Airlines flight from Izmir, Turkey, to Frankfurt, Germany, in 1990, when his mother went into labour during the descent.
Erkan Geldi is now a Turkish Airlines flight attendant - after having been born on board a Turkish Airlines flight in 1990
After being named after the pilot who was flying that day, Erkan has since returned to his roots - literally - by joining the company as a member of its flight crew.
'My father worked in Germany and we took a plane twice a year to visit,' Erkan tells Road Warrior Voices of his early start in the sky. 'I wondered every time I saw a plane what it must be like to work there.'

Volcanic lightning, 600-mile-long clouds and mesmerising... 12 shares After graduating with a bachelor's diploma in teaching English from university, Erkan applied for a job as a flight attendant.
'During the interview process, they asked me why I picked this occupation. I replied that actually the occupation chose me!'
Erkan was born on the aircraft after his mother went into labour during a descent into Frankfurt, Germany
After graduating from university, Erkan applied for a job with the company, saying 'the occupation chose [him]'
Today he enjoys meeting new people on board his flights - though admits he's never had a passenger go into labour on his watch
Today, in his role, Erkan most enjoys having the daily opportunity to meet new and interesting people on board.
And although he hasn't yet been working a flight where someone has gone into labour, Erkan hopes that perhaps some day he'll get to experience it from the other side.
'There have only been two other births aboard a Turkish Airlines plane in the past few decades,' he added. 'I will be ready if needed though, as we are trained for a lot of different emergency situations on board.'
